item.title: PGP&GPG
item.description: PGP (Pretty Good Privacy) Pretty good tool for encryption & decryption, as well as verifying file integrity. GPG/GnuPG tool Gnu Privacy Guard - the best free tool (afaik) for doing things with PGP.

item.title: robots.txt
item.description: robots.txt A semi-informal standard made by Google to tell webscraping robots (provided they are polite; some aren‚Äôt) to fuck off. See official Google documentation here.

item.title: Kubernetes theory
item.description: Kubernetes For more low-level practical stuff, go to docs on Docker and K8s basics. For what reason? [].

item.title: Minikube & K8s basics
item.description: Minikube A lot of starter stuff here follows from starter Go+Docker stuff at Docker basics. Deploying a Go helowoorld on Minikube First off, ensure you have Docker installed and Docker group set up.

item.title: Deploying EC2 with... everything.
item.description: Let‚Äôs get straight to business. What do we want to do? Deploy an AWS EC2 instance in a fantastically diverse collection of ways. Not including clicking through things in a web UI (that‚Äôs cool but too slow and too easy, thus very boring) nor especially pulling an untrustworthy LLM-generated YAML or Bash script from Amazon Q itself (or loose sequence of 3 commands, to be more precise).

item.title: Firewalls on Linux
item.description: firewalld Firewall. ufw AKA uncomplicated firewall; a firewall config tool running on top of iptables. Common with Ubuntu-based distros (e.g. Linux Mint).

item.title: SSH
item.description: OpenSSH (Secure Shell) OpenSSH is a collection of tools, here‚Äôs a brief overview of them all: ssh - ‚ÄúSecure Shell‚Äù, the command that allows a secure tunnel for a shell connection to ...

item.title: cURL cheatsheet
item.description: cURL cheatsheet Use a custom loopback interface (e.g. 127.1.2.3): curl --interface 127.1.2.3 -v http://127.57.57.57:8057/ Index of helpful links Everything curl.
